member.name: T:Xceed.Drawing.DashStyle
member.summary: Specifies the style of the dashed lines drawn with a Pen object.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.DashStyle.Solid
member.summary: The line will be solid.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.DashStyle.Dash
member.summary: The line will be made of a series of dashes.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.DashStyle.Dot
member.summary: The line will be made of a series of dots.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.DashStyle.DashDot
member.summary: The line will be made of a repeating dash-dot pattern.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.DashStyle.DashDotDot
member.summary: The line will be made of a repeating dash-dot-dot pattern.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.DashStyle.Custom
member.summary: The line will use a custom style.

member.name: T:Xceed.Drawing.FontStyle
member.summary: Specifies the style that will be applied to the text.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.FontStyle.Regular
member.summary: The text will not be stylized.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.FontStyle.Bold
member.summary: The text will be in bold.

summary.para: The text will be in italic.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.FontStyle.Underline
member.summary: A line will be added below the text.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.FontStyle.Strikeout
member.summary: A line will go through the text.

member.name: T:Xceed.Drawing.Color
member.summary: Encapsulates a SkiaSharp.SKColor in .NET5+ or a System.Drawing.Color in .NET Framework.

member.name: T:Xceed.Drawing.Point
member.summary: Encapsulates a SkiaSharp.SKPoint in .NET5+ or a System.Drawing.Point in NET Framework.

remarks.para: In .NET5+, this will create a SKPoint.
In .NET Framework, this will create a System.Drawing.Point.

member.name: T:Xceed.Drawing.PointF
member.summary: Encapsulates a SkiaSharp.SKPoint in .NET5+ or a System.Drawing.PointF in .NET Framework.

member.name: T:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF
member.summary: Encapsulates a SkiaSharp.SKRect in .NET5+ or a System.Drawing.RectangleF in .NET Framework.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.#ctor(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates a new Color object from a color.

remarks.para: In .NET5+, this will create a SKColor.
In .NET Framework, this will create a System.Drawing.Color.

member.param: The color that will be encapsulated.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.GetBrightness
member.summary: Returns the Color's brightness.
member.remarks: The brightness value is taken from the Color's hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) values. It ranges from 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 represents black & 1.0 represents white.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.GetHue
member.summary: Returns the Color's hue.
member.remarks: The hue value is taken from its hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) values. It is measured in degrees & ranges from 0.0 to 360.0.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.GetSaturation
member.summary: Returns the Color's saturation.
member.remarks: The saturation value is taken from its hue-saturation-brightness (HSB) values. It ranges from 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 is grayscale & 1.0 is the most saturated.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.IsKnownColor(System.String)
member.summary: Will return true if the value string corresponds to one of the SKColors in .NET5+ or one of the System.Drawing.KnownColor in .NET Framework.
member.param: The string that will be evaluated.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.Parse
member.summary: Creates a Color from specific values.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.ToArgb
member.summary: Returns the Color's 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Color from the stringColor parameter.
member.param: The string that will be used to create the Color.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.Parse(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a Color from 8-bit color values (Red, Green & Blue).
member.remarks: Note that the Alpha value is implicitly 255, which automatically makes the created Color fully opaque.
member.param: The Red component's value. Valid values go from 0 to 255.GreenBlue

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.Parse(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a Color from the four ARGB components' values (Alpha, Red, Green & Blue).
member.param: The Alpha component's value. Valid values go from 0 to 255.RedGreenBlue

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.Parse(System.Int32,Xceed.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Creates a Color based on an existing Color object, but with a new alpha value.
member.param: The new Color's Alpha value. Valid values go from 0 to 255.ColorColor

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Color.Parse(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a Color from a 32-bit ARGB value.
member.param: Specifies the new Color's 32-bit ARGB value.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.Color.A
member.summary: Get's the Color's Alpha byte.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.Color.B
member.summary: Gets the Color's Blue byte.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.Color.G
member.summary: Get's the Color's Green byte.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.Color.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets if the Color is empty.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.Color.Name
member.summary: Gets the Color's name.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.Color.R
member.summary: Gets the Color's Red byte.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.Color.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the Color object.

remarks.para: In .NET5+, the value is a SKColor.
In .NET Framework, the value is a System.Drawing.Color.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Point.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new Point object from x & y coordinates.

remarks.para: In .NET5+, this will create a SKPoint.
In .NET Framework, this will create a System.Drawing.Point.

member.param: The Point's x coordinate.Pointy

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.Point.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the Point's x coordinate.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.Point.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the Point's y coordinate.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.PointF.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new PointF object from x & y coordinates.

remarks.para: In .NET5+, this will create a SKPoint.
In .NET Framework, this will create a System.Drawing.PointF.

member.param: The PointF's x coordinate.PointFy

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.PointF.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the PointF's x coordinate.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.PointF.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the PointF's y coordinate.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new RectangleF by determining its Width & Height, along with the location of its top left corner.
member.param: The left coordinate associated with the RectangleF's top left corner.RectangleFRectangleFWidthRectangleFHeight

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.Bottom
member.summary: Gets the y coordinate that corresponds to the sum of the Y &Height properties.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the RectangleF's height.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.Left
member.summary: Gets the x coordinate that corresponds to the left edge of the RectangleF.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.Right
member.summary: Gets the x coordinate that corresponds to the sum of the X & Width properties.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.Top
member.summary: Gets the y coordinate that corresponds to the top edge of the RectangleF.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the RectangleF object.

remarks.para: In .NET5+, the value is a SKRect.
In .NET Framework, the value is a System.Drawing.RectangleF.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the RectangleF's width.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.X
member.summary: Gets or sets the x coordinate that corresponds to the upper left corner of the RectangleF.

member.name: P:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.Y
member.summary: Gets or sets the y coordinate that corresponds to the upper left corner of the RectangleF.

member.name: F:Xceed.Drawing.RectangleF.Empty
member.summary: Creates an empty RectangleF.

In .NET Framework, this will create a System.Drawing.Font.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Font.#ctor(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a new Font object using fontFamily & fontSize values.

remarks.para: In .NET5+, this will create a SKFont.
In .NET Framework, this will create a System.Drawing.Font.
Note that the FontStyle value will default to Regular.

member.param: The font family to which the created Font will belong.Font

member.summary: Releases all resources used by the Font.

member.param: The Font that will be evaluated.FontFonttrueFont

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Font.GetTextHeight(System.String,System.String,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the text's height, based on the Font's Name & Size, as well as the text block's width.
member.remarks: Note that the text will wrap when reaching the value of the columnWidthInPixels parameter.
member.param: The text that will be evaluated.NameFontSizeFontThe text block's width.

member.name: M:Xceed.Drawing.Font.GetTextWidth(System.String,System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the text's width, based on the Font's Name & Size.
